thread.title: MoneyGram 2Q results top forecasts, new CEO named
thread.title_full: MoneyGram 2Q results top forecasts, new CEO named

title: MoneyGram 2Q results top forecasts, new CEO named
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Jul 31, 2015, 9:46 PM SGT - Singapore Markets closed MoneyGram 2Q results top forecasts, new CEO named MoneyGram reports better-than-expected second-quarter results, names new CEO Associated Press â€“ 1 hour 14 minutes ago Print 
NEW YORK (AP) -- MoneyGram International Inc. reported better-than-expected second-quarter financial results and named W. Alexander Holmes as its new CEO. 
Holmes, now the money transfer company's chief financial and chief operating officer, will succeed Pamela H. Patsley on Jan. 1. 
The Dallas-based company said it had a loss of $12.4 million, or 20 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs and stock option expense, came to 23 cents per share. 
The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of five analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 16 cents per share. 
The company posted revenue of $358.8 million in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Three analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $346.1 million. 
MoneyGram shares have dropped 13 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has decreased 46 percent in the last 12 months. 

Elements of this story were generated by Automated Insights (http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on MGI at http://www.zacks.com/ap/MGI
